alert.note: Alert for Sanilac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sanilac County through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Peck, or 7 miles south of Sandusky, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Peck around 435 PM EDT. Applegate around 450 PM EDT. Croswell around 455 PM EDT. Lexington around 500 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Birch Beach, Watertown, Lexington Heights, Roseburg, Amador, Valley Center and Juhl. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
